greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals, where column k is Euler transform of (j->j*k).
comment: A(n,k) is the number of partitions of n when parts i are of k*i kinds. A(2,2) = 7: [2a], [2b], [2c], [2d], [1a,1a], [1a,1b], [1b,1b].
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: A:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n=0, 1, k*add(
mathematica: A[n_, k_] := A[n, k] = If[n==0, 1, k*Sum[A[n-j, k]*DivisorSigma[2, j], {j, 1, n}]/n]; Table[Table[A[n, d-n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 12}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 02 2016, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 11 2015
